00001 /*******************************************************************************
00002 *
00003 * FILE:           safer.h
00004 *
00005 * DESCRIPTION:    block-cipher algorithm SAFER (Secure And Fast Encryption
00006 *                 Routine) in its four versions: SAFER K-64, SAFER K-128,
00007 *                 SAFER SK-64 and SAFER SK-128.
00008 *
00009 * AUTHOR:         Richard De Moliner (demoliner@isi.ee.ethz.ch)
00010 *                 Signal and Information Processing Laboratory
00011 *                 Swiss Federal Institute of Technology
00012 *                 CH-8092 Zuerich, Switzerland
00013 *
00014 * DATE:           September 9, 1995
00015 *
00016 * CHANGE HISTORY:
00017 *
00018 *******************************************************************************/
00019 #ifndef SAFER_H
00020 #define SAFER_H
00021 
00022 /******************* External Headers *****************************************/
00023 
00024 /******************* Local Headers ********************************************/
00025  
00026 /******************* Constants ************************************************/
00027 #define SAFER_K64_DEFAULT_NOF_ROUNDS     6
00028 #define SAFER_K128_DEFAULT_NOF_ROUNDS   10
00029 #define SAFER_SK64_DEFAULT_NOF_ROUNDS    8
00030 #define SAFER_SK128_DEFAULT_NOF_ROUNDS  10
00031 #define SAFER_MAX_NOF_ROUNDS            13
00032 #define SAFER_BLOCK_LEN                  8
00033 #define SAFER_KEY_LEN     (1 + SAFER_BLOCK_LEN * (1 + 2 * SAFER_MAX_NOF_ROUNDS))
00034 
00035 /******************* Assertions ***********************************************/
00036 
00037 /******************* Macros ***************************************************/
00038  
00039 /******************* Types ****************************************************/
00040 typedef unsigned char safer_block_t[SAFER_BLOCK_LEN];
00041 typedef unsigned char safer_key_t[SAFER_KEY_LEN];
00042 
00043 /******************* Module Data **********************************************/
00044 
00045 /******************* Prototypes ***********************************************/
00046 
00047 /*******************************************************************************
00048 * void Safer_Init_Module(void)
00049 *
00050 *   initializes this module.
00051 *
00052 ********************************************************************************
00053 * void Safer_Expand_Userkey(safer_block_t userkey_1,
00054 *                           safer_block_t userkey_2,
00055 *                           unsigned int nof_rounds,
00056 *                           int strengthened,
00057 *                           safer_key_t key)
00058 *
00059 *   expands a user-selected key of length 64 bits or 128 bits to a encryption /
00060 *   decryption key. If your user-selected key is of length 64 bits, then give
00061 *   this key to both arguments 'userkey_1' and 'userkey_2', e.g.
00062 *   'Safer_Expand_Userkey(z, z, key)'. Note: SAFER K-64 and SAFER SK-64 with a
00063 *   user-selected key 'z' of length 64 bits are identical to SAFER K-128 and
00064 *   SAFER SK-128 with a user-selected key 'z z' of length 128 bits,
00065 *   respectively.
00066 *   pre:  'userkey_1'  contains the first 64 bits of user key.
00067 *         'userkey_2'  contains the second 64 bits of user key.
00068 *         'nof_rounds' contains the number of encryption rounds
00069 *                      'nof_rounds' <= 'SAFER_MAX_NOF_ROUNDS'
00070 *         'strengthened' is non-zero if the strengthened key schedule should be
00071 *                      used and zero if the original key schedule should be
00072 *                      used.
00073 *   post: 'key'        contains the expanded key.
00074 *
00075 ********************************************************************************
00076 * void Safer_Encrypt_Block(safer_block_t block_in, safer_key_t key, 
00077 *                          safer_block_t block_out)
00078 *
00079 *   encryption algorithm.
00080 *   pre:  'block_in'  contains the plain-text block.
00081 *         'key'       contains the expanded key.
00082 *   post: 'block_out' contains the cipher-text block.
00083 *
00084 ********************************************************************************
00085 * void Safer_Decrypt_Block(safer_block_t block_in, safer_key_t key,
00086 *                          safer_block_t block_out)
00087 *
00088 *   decryption algorithm.
00089 *   pre:  'block_in'  contains the cipher-text block.
00090 *         'key'       contains the expanded key.
00091 *   post: 'block_out' contains the plain-text block.
00092 *
00093 *******************************************************************************/
00094 
00095 #ifndef NOT_ANSI_C
00096     extern void Safer_Init_Module(void);
00097     extern void Safer_Expand_Userkey(safer_block_t userkey_1,
00098                                      safer_block_t userkey_2,
00099                                      unsigned int nof_rounds,
00100                                      int strengthened,
00101                                      safer_key_t key);
00102     extern void Safer_Encrypt_Block (safer_block_t block_in, safer_key_t key, 
00103                                      safer_block_t block_out);
00104     extern void Safer_Decrypt_Block (safer_block_t block_in, safer_key_t key,
00105                                      safer_block_t block_out);
00106 #else
00107 #endif
